Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394848) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394848)
